TypeSignature.Value: public class SearchView : Android.Widget.LinearLayout, Android.Views.ICollapsibleActionView, IDisposable

.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SearchView extends Android.Widget.LinearLayout implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Android.Views.ICollapsibleActionView, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: A widget that provides a user interface for the user to enter a search query and submit a request to a search provider.

remarks.para:
A widget that provides a user interface for the user to enter a search query and submit a request to a search provider. Shows a list of query suggestions or results, if available, and allows the user to pick a suggestion or result to launch into.
Developer Guides
When the SearchView is used in an ActionBar as an action view for a collapsible menu item, it needs to be set to iconified by default using . This is the default, so nothing needs to be done.
If you want the search field to always be visible, then call setIconifiedByDefault(false).
For information about using SearchView, read the Search developer guide.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool Iconified { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Returns the current iconified state of the SearchView.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Returns the current iconified state of the SearchView.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Iconifies or expands the SearchView. Any query text is cleared when iconified. This is a temporary state and does not override the default iconified state set by . If the default state is iconified, then a false here will only be valid until the user closes the field. And if the default state is expanded, then a true here will only clear the text field and not close it.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool QueryRefinementEnabled { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Returns whether query refinement is enabled for all items or only specific ones.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Returns whether query refinement is enabled for all items or only specific ones.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Specifies if a query refinement button should be displayed alongside each suggestion or if it should depend on the flags set in the individual items retrieved from the suggestions provider. Clicking on the query refinement button will replace the text in the query text field with the text from the suggestion. This flag only takes effect if a SearchableInfo has been specified with and not when using a custom adapter.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetIconifiedByDefault(bool iconified) cil managed

Docs.param: whether the search field should be iconified by default
Docs.summary: Sets the default or resting state of the search field.

remarks.para: Sets the default or resting state of the search field. If true, a single search icon is shown by default and expands to show the text field and other buttons when pressed. Also, if the default state is iconified, then it collapses to that state when the close button is pressed. Changes to this property will take effect immediately.
The default value is true.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetSearchableInfo(class Android.App.SearchableInfo searchable) cil managed

Docs.param: a SearchableInfo can be retrieved from the SearchManager, for a specific activity or a global search provider.
Docs.summary: Sets the SearchableInfo for this SearchView.

remarks.para: Sets the SearchableInfo for this SearchView. Properties in the SearchableInfo are used to display labels, hints, suggestions, create intents for launching search results screens and controlling other affordances such as a voice button.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool SubmitButtonEnabled { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Returns whether the submit button is enabled when necessary or never displayed.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Returns whether the submit button is enabled when necessary or never displayed.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Enables showing a submit button when the query is non-empty. In cases where the SearchView is being used to filter the contents of the current activity and doesn't launch a separate results activity, then the submit button should be disabled.

Docs.summary: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Widget.CursorAdapter SuggestionsAdapter { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Returns the adapter used for suggestions, if any.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Returns the adapter used for suggestions, if any.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
You can set a custom adapter if you wish. Otherwise the default adapter is used to display the suggestions from the suggestions provider associated with the SearchableInfo.

This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
